SKOS_CONCEPT.alt_label: FDA RPS Pharmacokinetics: Absorption
SKOS_CONCEPT.definition: The branch of pharmacokinetics that studies the process by which a drug is absorbed by the body.

SKOS_CONCEPT.alt_label: Absorption, Distribution, Metabolism and Excretion
SKOS_CONCEPT.definition: A study that is designed to investigate the absorption, distribution, metabolism and excretion of a drug.

SKOS_CONCEPT.alt_label: FDA RPS Analytical Methods And Validation Reports
SKOS_CONCEPT.definition: An indication or description of the process by which the truth of something is tested or found.

SKOS_CONCEPT.alt_label: FDA RPS Other Toxicity Studies: Antigenicity
SKOS_CONCEPT.definition: A toxicity study that assesses the ability of a substance to induce an antigenic response in an animal.
A study of the degree to which or rate at which a drug or other substance is absorbed or becomes available at the site of physiological activity after administration. (NCI)

SKOS_CONCEPT.alt_label: FDA RPS Toxicology: Carcinogenicity
SKOS_CONCEPT.definition: A study that assesses the toxic effects of a compound in animals after repeated administrations with particular emphasis on determining the carcinogenicity of the compound.
The study of the effects of drugs upon the heart or circulatory system.
The branch of pharmacology that deals with the central nervous system. (NCI)

SKOS_CONCEPT.alt_label: FDA RPS Other Toxicity Studies: Dependence
SKOS_CONCEPT.definition: A study that assesses the capacity of a substance to become an abuse liability.

SKOS_CONCEPT.alt_label: FDA RPS Pharmacokinetics: Distribution
SKOS_CONCEPT.definition: The branch of pharmacokinetics that studies the process by which a drug is distributed by the body.
A study that assesses the efficacy of prophylactic treatment given after exposure to the challenge agent(s) but before the manifestation of the disease or condition.
A study that assesses the efficacy of a radiomitigator (given after exposure to the challenge agent(s) but before the manifestation of the disease or condition).
A study that assesses the efficacy of prophylactic treatment (including radioprotectors) given before exposure to the challenge agent(s).
A study that assesses the efficacy of treatment given after a protocol-defined manifestation of the challenge agent(s)-induced disease or condition.

SKOS_CONCEPT.alt_label: FDA RPS Reproductive And Developmental Toxicity: Embryofetal Development
SKOS_CONCEPT.definition: A toxicity study that assesses the effects of a substance on embryonic and fetal development.
SKOS_CONCEPT.pref_label: Reproductive and Developmental Toxicity: Embryofetal Development

SKOS_CONCEPT.alt_label: FDA RPS Pharmacokinetics: Excretion
SKOS_CONCEPT.definition: The branch of pharmacokinetics that studies the process by which a drug is eliminated by the body.

SKOS_CONCEPT.alt_label: FDA RPS Reproductive And Developmental Toxicity: Fertility And Early Embryonic Development
SKOS_CONCEPT.definition: A study that assesses the effects of a substance on an organism's fertility and/or embryonic development.
SKOS_CONCEPT.pref_label: Reproductive and Developmental Toxicity: Fertility and Early Embryonic Development

SKOS_CONCEPT.definition: The branch of pharmacology that deals with the gastrointestinal system. (NCI)

SKOS_CONCEPT.alt_label: FDA RPS Genotoxicity: In Vitro
SKOS_CONCEPT.definition: A genotoxicity study that tests the ability of a substance to cause DNA damage not in intact animals, but in cells or other systems.

SKOS_CONCEPT.alt_label: FDA RPS Genotoxicity: In Vivo
SKOS_CONCEPT.definition: A genotoxicity study that tests the ability of a substance to cause DNA damage within the body.

SKOS_CONCEPT.alt_label: FDA RPS Other Toxicity Studies: Immunotoxicity
SKOS_CONCEPT.definition: A toxicity study that assesses potential harm to the immune system.

SKOS_CONCEPT.alt_label: FDA RPS Other Toxicity Studies: Impurities
SKOS_CONCEPT.definition: A study that assesses the effects of impurities that may be found in a substance.

SKOS_CONCEPT.alt_label: FDA RPS Studies In Which The Offspring (Juvenile Animals) Are Dosed And/Or Further Evaluated
SKOS_CONCEPT.definition: A toxicology study that assesses the effects of a substance on a subject that received treatment and/or was dosed beginning during the juvenile stage of development.
SKOS_CONCEPT.pref_label: Studies in which the Offspring (Juvenile Animals) are Dosed and/or Further Evaluated

SKOS_CONCEPT.alt_label: FDA RPS Toxicology: Local Tolerance
SKOS_CONCEPT.definition: A toxicology study that assesses the effects of a substance when administered to a restricted portion of the body.

SKOS_CONCEPT.alt_label: FDA RPS Other Toxicity Studies: Mechanistic Studies
SKOS_CONCEPT.definition: A study that investigates the process by which a substance induces its effects.

SKOS_CONCEPT.alt_label: FDA RPS Pharmacokinetics: Metabolism
SKOS_CONCEPT.definition: The branch of pharmacokinetics that studies the process by which a drug is metabolized by the body.

SKOS_CONCEPT.alt_label: FDA RPS Other Toxicity Studies: Metabolites
SKOS_CONCEPT.definition: A study that evaluates the effects of a metabolite of a substance.
A study that monitors the development and progression of a disease or condition.
A study to test whether certain biological agents (e.g., viruses) or materials (e.g., nucleic acids) are capable of immortalizing cells and endowing them with the capacity to form tumors.

SKOS_CONCEPT.alt_label: FDA RPS Pharmacology: Pharmacodynamic Drug Interactions
SKOS_CONCEPT.definition: The branch of pharmacology that deals with the mechanism of action and biochemical and physiological effects of drug-drug interactions.

SKOS_CONCEPT.alt_label: FDA RPS Pharmacokinetics: Drug Interactions
SKOS_CONCEPT.definition: The branch of pharmacokinetics that studies the process by which two or more drugs in a system are absorbed, distributed, metabolized, and eliminated by the body.

A study that assesses a toxic response from a substance which is either elicited or increased (apparent at lower dose levels) after subsequent exposure to light, or that is induced by skin irradiation after systemic administration of a substance (adapted from OECD Guideline for Testing of Chemicals, copyright OECD, 2004, TG 432).

SKOS_CONCEPT.alt_label: FDA RPS Reproductive And Developmental Toxicity: Prenatal And Postnatal Development Including Maternal Function
SKOS_CONCEPT.definition: A toxicity study that assesses the effects of a substance on an organism's development shortly before and after birth.
SKOS_CONCEPT.pref_label: Reproductive and Developmental Toxicity: Prenatal and Postnatal Development Including Maternal Function

SKOS_CONCEPT.alt_label: FDA RPS Pharmacology: Primary Pharmacodynamics
SKOS_CONCEPT.definition: The branch of pharmacology that deals with the biochemical and physiological effects of a drug and the mechanism of drug action in relation to its desired therapeutic target.
The science concerned with drugs and their actions and uses in kidney biology and the treatment of kidney disease. (NCI)

SKOS_CONCEPT.alt_label: FDA RPS Toxicology: Repeat Dose Toxicity
SKOS_CONCEPT.definition: A study that assesses the toxic effects of a compound in animals after repeated administrations.
SKOS_CONCEPT.pref_label: Toxicology: Repeat Dose Toxicity [Species, Route, Duration]

SKOS_CONCEPT.definition: The branch of pharmacology that deals with the respiratory system. (NCI)

SKOS_CONCEPT.alt_label: FDA RPS Pharmacology: Secondary Pharmacodynamics
SKOS_CONCEPT.definition: The branch of pharmacology that deals with the biochemical and physiological effects of a drug and the mechanism of drug action not related to its desired therapeutic target.

SKOS_CONCEPT.alt_label: FDA RPS Toxicology: Single Dose Toxicity
SKOS_CONCEPT.definition: A study that assesses the toxic effects of a compound in animals after a single administration.
SKOS_CONCEPT.pref_label: Toxicology: Single Dose Toxicity [Species and Route]

SKOS_CONCEPT.definition: Evaluation of the absorption, distribution, metabolism and excretion of a substance in relation to its toxicity in an animal.
A study in which immortalized cells form tumors when inoculated into animals.
